page.title: 10Religion In Our Villages.
page.content: Blechingley church is called St.Mary's. It is very old and is visited by many people. The vicar sometimes comes to our school. The steeple is quite high and very thick in its lower storey. About 370 people can be seated in the church as well as the choir. Godstone's church is called St.Nicholas. It chief asset is its attractive setting and its practical size, nowadays put to good use by internal rearrangement. There is an organ in the Church which was given in memory of Sir Bernard Greenwell of Marden Park.
